text: The latter, unless you have a clever way of computing the preconditioned residual without first computing the residual then precondition it

elements.text: The latter, unless you have a clever way of computing the preconditioned residual without first computing the residual then precondition it

text: Wouldn’t you have solved the problem if you know the residual so that it can be preconditioned?

elements.text: Wouldn’t you have solved the problem if you know the residual so that it can be preconditioned?

text: The point is that if you can somehow compute a well conditioned residual without roundoff error then you're in the clear

elements.text: The point is that if you can somehow compute a well conditioned residual without roundoff error then you're in the clear

text: Eg if A is an ill conditioned diagonal matrix, the ill conditioning does not actually matter too much because you can precondition it (exactly or approximately) in a way that does not lead to intermediate rounding (because roundoff error only occurs at addition, not at multiplication or division)

elements.text: Eg if A is an ill conditioned diagonal matrix, the ill conditioning does not actually matter too much because you can precondition it (exactly or approximately) in a way that does not lead to intermediate rounding (because roundoff error only occurs at addition, not at multiplication or division)

text: I see. What are the techniques for finding such preconditioners?

elements.text: I see. What are the techniques for finding such preconditioners?

text: hope your problem has a nice structure?

text: typically for a PDE this would be like reformulating the PDE as an integral equation

text: I'm talking in generalities. I attended a talk on preconditioners for the exascale and was just ruminating.
